intro: Rubus gallicus, commonly known as the French blackberry, is a species of bramble native to Europe. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, fertile ground. Rubus gallicus is often found in woodland edges, hedgerows, and disturbed areas.
